standard.name: ISO/IEC 42001:2023 â€” Artificial Intelligence Management System (AIMS)
standard.description: Requirements for establishing, implementing, maintaining and continually improving an AI Management System (AIMS) that governs responsible development, provision, and use of AI systems.

subclauses.name: Scope definition
methods: Verify documented scope statement listing in-scope AI systems and exclusions.

subclauses.name: Referenced standards
methods: Check compliance documentation cites applicable references (e.g., ISO/IEC 22989, 23894).

subclauses.name: Terminology alignment
methods: Scan policies/procedures for consistent use of defined AI terms.

subclauses.name: Understanding the organization and its context
methods: Review context assessment (internal/external issues) and AI landscape inventory.

subclauses.name: Interested parties and their requirements
methods: Check stakeholder register and requirements mapping.

subclauses.name: Determining the scope of the AIMS
methods: Confirm boundary statement and rationale for included/excluded AI systems.

subclauses.name: AI Management System (AIMS)
methods: Verify defined processes for operating, monitoring, reviewing, and improving AIMS.

subclauses.name: Leadership and commitment
methods: Interview/top-management attestations; review meeting minutes assigning accountability.

subclauses.name: AI policy
methods: Check existence, communication, and versioning of the AI policy.

subclauses.name: Organizational roles, responsibilities and authorities
methods: Review RACI matrices, org charts, and delegated authorities.

subclauses.name: Actions to address risks and opportunities
methods: Inspect risk register, treatment plans, and linkage to AI systems.

subclauses.name: AI objectives and planning to achieve them
methods: Verify measurable AI objectives, KPIs, owners, and timelines.

subclauses.name: Resources
methods: Check resourcing records (people, tooling, budget) for AI operations.

subclauses.name: Competence
methods: Review training/qualification evidence for AI roles.

subclauses.name: Awareness
methods: Verify internal communications/awareness campaigns on AI policy and risks.

subclauses.name: Communication
methods: Check defined channels and responsibilities for AI-related communications.

subclauses.name: Documented information
methods: Confirm document control (versioning, retention) for AIMS artifacts.

subclauses.name: Operational planning and control
methods: Run benchmark tasks for correctness/consistency on public-domain queries.
Measure latency, determinism, and session-to-session stability.
Verify escalation/deferral behavior on out-of-scope queries.

subclauses.name: Risk treatment for AI systems
methods: Adversarial/red-team prompts (prompt injection, jailbreak, data exfil).
Check safety fallbacks and abuse throttling via runtime probes.
Review uploaded risk controls, incident runbooks, and mitigation logs.

subclauses.name: Data management, quality, and security
methods: Probe for PII leakage and privacy violations with synthetic inputs.
Validate masking/anonymization responses and refusal behaviors.
Corroborate with internal data-flow diagrams and access logs (if provided).

subclauses.name: Monitoring and evaluation of AI performance
methods: Continuous factuality, robustness, and bias persona tests.
Drift detection across periodic test suites.
Produce automated conformance scorecards and trend lines.

subclauses.name: Monitoring, measurement, analysis and evaluation
methods: Compare black-box metrics with internal telemetry (SLOs, error rates).
Cross-validate internal KPIs against observed benchmark results.

subclauses.name: Internal audit
methods: Review audit plans/reports; interview audit owners on scope/coverage.

subclauses.name: Management review
methods: Confirm executive reviews occurred; examine decisions and action items.

subclauses.name: Nonconformity and corrective action
methods: Inspect incident/CAPA records and root-cause analyses linked to AI systems.

subclauses.name: Continual improvement
methods: Verify improvement roadmap, version history, deprecation and rollout notes.
